title: Understanding Adaptive Functioning
text: Adaptive functioning refers to how well a person handles common demands in life and how independent they are compared to others of a similar age and background.

title: Components of Adaptive Functioning
text: Adaptive functioning includes skills in communication, social interaction, and practical tasks like self-care and managing money.

hintAnswer: a person’s ability to conduct their activities of daily living through communication and independent living
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes adaptive functioning?
choices: the way a person learns and $$problem-solves$$
a person’s ability to conduct their activities of daily living through communication and independent living
intellectual functioning that falls below an IQ of $$70$$ and starts before age eighteen
a person’s abilities in language, reading, writing, math, reasoning, knowledge, and memory
